name: Brain Chips
the-point: Would you install a chip in your brain if it gave you instant access to the internet and perfect memory?

name: Digital Immortality
the-point: If you could upload your consciousness to a server after you die, would that actually be 'you'?
context: The definition of the soul in tech.

name: Robot Rights
the-point: When robots become indistinguishable from humans, should they be allowed to vote or own property?

name: Space Tourism
the-point: Would you take a one-way trip to colonize Mars if you knew you could never come back to Earth?

name: End of Money
the-point: Will physical cash completely disappear in our lifetime?

name: AI Teachers
the-point: Would you trust an AI to raise and educate your children better than a human could?
context: The role of empathy in development.

name: Genetic Design
the-point: Should we 'cure' things like shyness or low height through genetic editing before birth?

name: Virtual Reality
the-point: Will humans eventually spend more time in VR than in the physical world?
context: Escapism and the future of social life.

name: Automated Labor
the-point: What happens to society when AI can do 90% of all current jobs better than humans?

name: Climate Tech
the-point: Can technology save the planet, or is the only solution for humans to consume less?

name: Deepfakes
the-point: Will we reach a point where video evidence can no longer be trusted in a court of law?

name: Cyborg Sports
the-point: Should athletes be allowed to use bionic limbs if it makes them faster than any 'natural' human?

name: The Last Job
the-point: What do you think will be the very last job that an AI replaces?

name: Smart Cities
the-point: Would you live in a city where every move you make is tracked to optimize traffic and energy use?

name: Meat Labs
the-point: Would you eat 'lab-grown' meat if it tasted exactly like a real cow but no animal was killed?

name: Alien Signal
the-point: If we receive a signal from deep space, should we answer it or stay quiet to avoid being found?

name: Tech Addiction
the-point: Is it possible for a human to be 'sober' from technology in the modern world?

name: Algorithmic Dating
the-point: Would you let an AI pick your marriage partner if it had a 99% success rate?

name: Universal Translator
the-point: If everyone could understand every language instantly via a device, would world peace be more likely?

name: Flying Cars
the-point: Are flying cars a great idea, or would they just be a terrifying nightmare for safety?

name: Life Extension
the-point: If the average lifespan becomes 150 years, at what age should people be allowed to retire?

name: AI Creativity
the-point: Can a computer ever have a 'soulful' moment, or is it always just repeating patterns?

name: Encryption Wars
the-point: Should the government have a 'backdoor' key to all encrypted messages to stop crime?

name: Nanotechnology
the-point: Would you drink water filled with microscopic robots designed to clean your arteries?

name: The Singularity
the-point: Is the creation of Super-Intelligent AI the best or worst thing that will ever happen to humanity?
